newsitem.title: FINLAND: Helsinki bourse hits record-high close in quiet trade.
newsitem.headline: Helsinki bourse hits record-high close in quiet trade.

text.p: Finnish shares edged higher on Thursday amid moderately lively action in second-tier stocks while blue-chips like telecoms group Nokia, forestry firm UPM-Kymmene and bank Merita closed unchanged.

The HEX all-share index posted its second record-high close in as many days, advancing 7.7 points or 0.3 percent to 2,380.4 points -- up 39 percent this year, but still 0.8 percent below its all-time peak set in intra-day trade last Friday.

Turnover was a muted 390 million markka with Nokia's slice of total smaller than usual at 30 percent. Nokia was unmoved by news of a $80 million contract to expand a mobile phone GSM network in China. It closed unchanged at 259.00 markka.
Two surveys indicating better times ahead for the forest industry failed to lift UPM-Kymmene. The share of Europe's largest forest industry group was unchanged at 89.00 markka.

Wholesaler Kesko recovered some of this week's losses linked to the EU Commission's rejection of its merger with domestic rival Tuko. Passenger ferry operator Silja rose on news of a debt-for-equity swap.
